results.title: Australia marches with Britain
results.creator_credit: Ken G. Hall and National Films Council
results.brief_description: Highlights of the National War Effort. Reaping the wheat, shearing sheep, producing butter, eggs, felling trees for timber. Industry producing metals, Bren Gun carriers, shells, guns, ships, planes, exporting the lot to England. Total war effort to fight enemy. Australian Army, Navy and Air Force personnel training and embarking for service overseas. Commentary by Peter Bathurst.

results.title: The Sunny south-west
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Industry and Commerce
results.brief_description: Travelogue which covers a region of South-West Western Australia. Has scenes of Perth on the Swan River and street scenes including trams. War Memorial in Kings Park. Rottnest Island, Yanchup Park, Green Mt. National Park and the Darling Ranges. Bunbury Harbour and its surrounds. Sleeper cutting by hand for the railways from hardwood forests. Albany, originally the major seaport of W.A. Rugged coastal scenes of the region of Calgan River and The Sterling Ranges.

results.title: The Melbourne Wedding Belle
results.creator_credit: Colin Dean, Maslyn Williams, Australia. Dept. of the Interior. Film Division and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Set to a poetic musical dialogue, this film shows the beauty of Melbourne and gardens as the bride, groom etc gather for a wedding at St John’s Church in Toorak (Melbourne).

results.title: Pacific terminal
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Information and Government of NSW
results.brief_description: A survey of the capital city of New South Wales, Sydney on Port Jackson. Includes aerial footage of Sydney; monuments in Macquarie Place; inland footage of shearers and bullocks hauling logs; and Australians enjoying a range of recreational activities.

results.title: Australia presents: Christmas in Australia
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Australia’s Christmas is not the traditional day of snow and ice, but a warm sweltering day in mid-summer. The old traditions are preserved.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Mason, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.description: Australia’s Christmas is not the traditional day of snow and ice, but a warm sweltering day in mid-summer. This film shows typical scenes of Christmas celebrations in 1950’s Australia, from the busy shops and streets of the cities, to small churches of rural country towns, even a festive feast at the beach.
description_for_label: Australia’s Christmas is not the traditional day of snow and ice, but a warm sweltering day in mid-summer. This film shows typical scenes of Christmas celebrations in 1950’s Australia, from the busy shops and streets of the cities, to small churches of rural country towns, even a festive feast at the beach.

results.title: A Place to live
results.creator_credit: Stuart Glover, Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Film Academy
results.brief_description: Story of immigration and discussion of how newcomers look for houses, units or commission housing on offer in the city. Immigration officers help migrants get loans and settle in ‘suburbia’, the ideal for many migrants.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stuart Glover, Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Film Academy

results.title: Ray of hope
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Designed for use in a national campaign against tuberculosis, this film describes the disease and preventive measures being taken to eradicate the disease from Australia. Shows the use of chest X-ray in detecting the disease; symptoms, nature and spread of tuberculosis; treatment of patients at sanatorium; importance of keeping children free from infection; use of BCG vaccine for the immunization of school children.
